EPA Facility ID Number: 100000036089

Facility Name: Beaver Valley Plant

Parent Company: NOVA Chemicals Inc. 

Executive Summary: 2020 Resubmission



Accidental Release Prevention and Emergency Response Policies:



NOVA Chemicals is a Responsible Care Company as a member of the American Chemistry Council. As a Responsible Care Company the facility follows the Responsible Care Codes of Management Practice, including the Community Awareness and Emergency Response (CAER) Code to assure emergency preparedness and foster community right-to-know.  NOVA Chemicals is committed to being a leader in achieving superior Responsible Care (i.e. RC) performance and its management programs require each manufacturing plant to have a pro-active community awareness and emergency response program to handle emergencies that might happen in that facility.  All of these activities form an integral part of Nova Chemicals Responsible Care and Sustainability Policy.



The Beaver Valley Plant's approach to chemical safety and accidental release prevention is best described by the NOVA Chemicals Responsible Care and Sustainability Policy which states "The following principles reflect the ethic of Responsible Care and sustainability and guide our actions as we carry out our mission."



1.    Operate our facilities and Responsible Care systems to meet or exceed the letter and spirit of industry codes of practice, regulations and legal requirements.

2.    Manage our business with the belief that products and processes can be managed in a sustainable manner and that personal and process incidents that could harm people, property or the environment can be prevented.

3.    Are responsible for our own personal safety and for the safety of the people and environment around us.

4.    Consider best available science, stakeholder input and best practices to identify and

manage issues and to continually improve our performance.

5.    Innovate to improve the ability of plastics to protect products, people and t

he environment through collaboration with our value chain partners.

6.    Ensure all employees and contractors understand their responsibilities to integrate Responsible Care and sustainability into their daily work.

7.    Provide the human, material and financial resources to meet our Responsible Care commitments.

8.    Create dialogue with our communities and near neighbors to share information,

seek input, respond to concerns, and to continuously improve our performance

as a responsible neighbor.

9.    Understand and communicate the health, safety, environmental and security impacts of

our raw materials and products throughout their lifecycle.

10.    Work with stakeholders to create public policy and standards that enhance sustainability.

11.    Measure and report our Responsible Care performance using feedback, audits and management systems in order to make changes which continuously improve our plans, programs and performance.

12.    Use our influence to create visibility and awareness for Responsible Care and sustainability throughout our facilities and in our communications, practices and relationships.    



Excellence in Responsible Care performance is everyone's responsibility.  All employees must adopt and encourage safe work practices and conduct all work-related activities in an environmentally responsible manner.  Leadership in all facilities and business units are accountable for their organization's Responsible Care performance, and for achieving satisfactory performance from their customers, suppliers, carriers and contractors





Description of the Stationary Source and Regulated Substances:



NOVA Chemicals' Beaver Valley plant is located at Monaca, Pennsylvania, approximately 25 miles (40 kilometers) northwest of Pittsburgh. The facility manufactures expandable polystyrene (EPS) resins, and ARCEL® advanced foam resin.  This site also houses a Styrenics Innovation Centre, which contains an applications lab, along with a pilot plant, for testing and custo

mer demonstrations. 



Site ownership transitioned over the years through the U.S. government, Koppers Company, Sinclair Oil Company, ARCO Chemical Company, to NOVA Chemicals, which is now wholly owned, ultimately by Mubadala Investment Company of the Emirate of Abu Dhabi, United Arab Emirates.



NOVA Chemicals' Beaver Valley plant is required to comply with the EPA 40 CFR 68, Risk Management Program (RMP) because n-pentane and iso-pentane are listed chemicals in Table 3 to ? 68.130 - List of Regulated Flammable Substances and Threshold Quantities for Accidental Release Prevention and are used in our manufacturing processes in amounts above the threshold quantity (TQ). Both n-pentane and iso-pentane are used to produce different grades of expandable polystyrene resin. 



General Accidental Release/Chemical-Specific Prevention Programs Steps



The processes previously described are as well covered under the Occupational Health and Safety Administration's Process Safety Management (PSM) Standard of Highly Hazardous Chemicals, OSHA 29 CFR 1910.119. A Management System focused on process safety (i.e. Process Safety Management System) has been developed at the facility to consist of the 14 independent programs to address the "elements" required under both the PSM Standard and Subpart D of Environmental Protection Agency's 40 CFR Part 68 Chemical Accident Prevention Provisions. These 14 programs and have been integrated into the accident prevention plan requirements under the facility's Risk Management Program. 



Compliance with the PSM Standard provides the foundation for compliance with the Risk Management Program, and there is a continuous effort to maintain and improve our compliance programs related to PSM. These specific programs have been integrated into the facility's daily operations and business model to ensure that there is adequate recognition and resources to effectively implement. Collectively, these prevention program activities help minimize potentia

l accident scenarios that could be caused by equipment failures; human errors; and external events. 



Five-year Accident History:



The NOVA Chemicals' Beaver Valley plant has had no reportable accidental releases (i.e. as defined by ? 68.42) of regulated substances in the past five years.



Emergency Response Program:



The NOVA Chemicals' Beaver Valley plant maintains a written integrated contingency plan, which is in place to protect worker and public safety as well as the environment.  The program consists of procedures for responding to a release of a regulated substance, including the possibility of a fire or explosion if a flammable substance is accidentally released.  The procedures address all aspects of emergency response, including proper first-aid and medical treatment for exposures, evacuation plans and accounting for personnel after evacuation, notification of local emergency response agencies and the public if a release occurs, and post incident cleanup and decontamination requirements.  



In addition, the NOVA Chemicals' Beaver Valley plant has procedures that address maintenance, inspection, and testing of emergency response equipment, as well as instructions that address the use of emergency response equipment. The facility maintains a supervised alarm system to aid in the notification or communication of Nova personnel to a spill or release.



Designated Nova personnel receive training in these procedures as necessary to perform their specific emergency response duties.  Additional these personnel are frequently drilled to tested their competency in performing these activities.



The overall integrated contingency plan for the NOVA Chemicals' Beaver Valley plant is coordinated with the Beaver County Local Emergency Planning Committees (LEPC).
